arm_group.description: 50 grams of whey blended into frozen drink
50 grams of polycose blended into frozen drink

brief_summary.textblock:
This research study was conducted to investigate the effects of a high protein diet on the
      efficiency of energy use at rest and at low-levels of physical activity. The hypothesis was
      that a high intake of dietary protein would result in a less efficient use of energy in
      skeletal muscle in older adults.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diet and Muscle Function In Older Adults

detailed_description.textblock:
This research study was conducted to investigate the effects of a high protein diet on the
      efficiency of energy use at rest and at low-levels of physical activity. The hypothesis was
      that a high intake of dietary protein would result in a less efficient use of energy in
      skeletal muscle in older adult

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  65 years and older

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Diabetic

          -  Acute symptoms of cardiovascular disease or congestive heart failure

          -  uncontrolled hypertension

          -  supplemental oxygen consumption at rest or during exercise

          -  lactose intolerance

          -  inability to ride a stationary cycle

intervention.description: subjects are asked to consume a smoothie with whey protein added
Subjects are asked to consume a beverage with polycose added

clinical_study.official_title: Diet and Muscle Function In Older Adults

overall_official.affiliation: Purdue University Dept of Nutrition Science

primary_outcome.description: gross mechanical efficiency of muscle, consuming high and low protein supplements
primary_outcome.measure: Dietary protein effects on muscle energy use
primary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be measured over an average of 26 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: effects of high protein or high carbohydrate supplements on overall energy consumption in older adults.
secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of protein supplements on food intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be measured over an average of 26 days

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
